intro: Anthospermum thymoides, commonly known as Indian thyme, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia, including India and Sri Lanka. It is a small shrub characterized by its aromatic, narrow leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes other aromatic herbs and shrubs. Its foliage is often used in traditional medicine for its purported antiseptic and anti-inflammatory properties. Anthospermum thymoides is also valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
